Package stincmale.ratmex.executor

Interface RateListener<E extends RateMeasuredEvent>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - A type of a RateMeasuredEvent which this listener can react to.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultRateListener, DefaultSubmitterWorkerRateListener

    public interface RateListener<E extends RateMeasuredEvent>
    A listener allowing monitoring the rate and reacting if there are deviations from the target rate.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean onMeasurement​(E e)
      This method is called by RateMeasuringExecutorService each time it decides it makes sense to notify about the current rate.

    • Method Detail

      • onMeasurement

        boolean onMeasurement​(E e)
               throws RateFailedException
        This method is called by RateMeasuringExecutorService each time it decides it makes sense to notify about the current rate. This method must never be called concurrently, and implementations of RateMeasuringExecutorService must not call the method concurrently.

        Any RuntimeException thrown from this method causes the scheduled execution for which the event was generated to terminate abnormally (i.e. cause method Future.get() to throw ExecutionException which provides the thrown exception via Throwable.getCause()).

        Parameters:
        e - An event with data provided by RateMeasuringExecutorService. An implementation of this method must not pass on a reference to the event in a way that allows accessing the event outside of this method invocation because an event is mutable and its contents are only guaranteed to stay unchanged within an invocation of this method. Data extracted from the event can, however, be transferred anywhere if that data is either primitive or immutable.
        Returns:
        true if the scheduled execution for which the event was generated must continue; otherwise it will be cancelled.
        Throws:
        RateFailedException - May be thrown if the target rate is not respected. Note that implementation of this method may choose to ignore the deviation and return true instead thus continuing the scheduled repetitive execution.
